cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (155 km) south of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north through the Windward Passage, forecast to turn north-northwest on Wednesday and track through the Bahamas toward the northwest, paralleling or clipping the southeast Florida coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Near or just offshore the southeast Florida coast (vicinity of Palm Beach to Cape Canaveral)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet – interests in the Florida Peninsula advised to monitor
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet – warnings confined to Haiti, Cuba and the Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast northward to Georgia and South Carolina likely to experience tropical-storm or hurricane conditions
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (34–63 kt) are likely; there is a 15% chance of hurricane-force gusts if the center tracks nearer the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Matthew moves close to shore, 3–5 ft of surge and large battering waves are possible along the barrier islands and Intracoastal Waterway.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts, producing flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous surf/rip currents expected; port operations may be suspended due to gale conditions and heavy rainfall.
